meanings.definition: A secret plan or scheme to accomplish a purpose.
meanings.sent1: The spy carefully crafted a plot to steal the valuable documents.
meanings.sent2: The villains in the movie had an evil plot to take over the city.
meanings.sent3: The plot to surprise the birthday girl with a party was almost ruined by a loud noise.
meanings.sent4: Her plot to outsmart her opponent in the game was both cunning and strategic.
meanings.sent5: The intricate plot to solve the mystery kept the audience on the edge of their seats.

meanings.definition: The main events of a play, novel, movie, or similar work, devised and presented by the writer as an interrelated sequence.
meanings.sent1: The plot of the story unfolded gradually, revealing unexpected twists.
meanings.sent2: In the play, the plot thickened as the characters faced new challenges.
meanings.sent3: The plot of the movie was so predictable that the audience started guessing the ending.
meanings.sent4: As the novel reached its climax, the plot reached a point of no return.
meanings.sent5: The intricate plot of the mystery novel kept readers guessing until the very end.
